meanings.meaning_en_US: To do something in a way that saves time or money but usually reduces quality.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 以节省时间或金钱，但通常会降低质量的方式做某事

examples.sentence: They [cut corners] when building the road, leading to safety issues.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他们在修建这条道路时偷工减料，导致了安全问题。

examples.sentence: If you [cut corners], you might regret it later.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你图省事，可能会在后续后悔。

examples.sentence: It's better to spend a little more than to [cut corners] on your health.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 花一点更多的钱总是更好，而不是在健康上图省事。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To return to a previous location or position.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 返回之前的位置或状态

examples.sentence: If we missed the turn, we'll need to [double back] to find it.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果我们错过了转弯，就需要返回来找它。

examples.sentence: He had to [double back] after forgetting his wallet.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他在忘记钱包后不得不返回。

examples.sentence: They had to [double back] when they realized they were lost.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 当他们意识到迷路时，他们不得不返回。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To commit oneself to a course of action in spite of difficulties.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 尽管面临困难，仍坚持某一行动

examples.sentence: She decided to [double down] on her training for the marathon.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她决定在马拉松训练中加倍努力。

examples.sentence: In tough times, he chose to [double down] on his business strategy.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在艰难时期，他选择坚持自己的商业策略。

examples.sentence: They need to [double down] if they want to win the championship.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果他们想赢得冠军，就需要加倍努力。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To gradually become distant in a relationship.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在关系中逐渐变得疏远

examples.sentence: As time went by, they [drifted apart].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 随着时间的推移，他们逐渐疏远了。

examples.sentence: Friends may [drift apart] after high school.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 朋友在高中后可能会逐渐疏远。

examples.sentence: Their different priorities caused them to [drift apart].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他们不同的优先事项导致他们疏远。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Very easy to do.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 非常简单

examples.sentence: This recipe is [easy as pie]; anyone can make it.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 这个食谱非常简单；任何人都能做。

examples.sentence: Don't worry, the test is [easy as pie].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 别担心，这个测试非常简单。

examples.sentence: Setting up the computer was [easy as pie].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 设置计算机非常简单。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To lag or fail to keep up with others.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 落后于或未能与他人保持同步

examples.sentence: If you don't study, you'll [fall behind] in class.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你不学习，你会在课堂上落后。

examples.sentence: She was so busy with work that she started to [fall behind] in her assignments.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她工作繁忙，开始在作业上落后了。

examples.sentence: They are trying to improve so they don’t [fall behind] the competition.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他们正在努力改进，以免在竞争中落后。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To make a decision by tossing a coin.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 通过投掷硬币来做决定

examples.sentence: If you can't decide, just [flip a coin].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你不能决定，就投掷硬币吧。

examples.sentence: We decided to [flip a coin] to see who goes first.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我们决定投个硬币，看看谁先来。

examples.sentence: When in doubt, I always [flip a coin] to make choices.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 当遇到疑惑时，我总是投个硬币来做选择。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To do the same thing as someone else.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 做与他人相同的事情

examples.sentence: If the leader resigns, others may [follow suit].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果领导辞职，其他人可能会效仿。

examples.sentence: She decided to [follow suit] and change her hairstyle.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她决定跟风，改变自己的发型。

examples.sentence: Many companies [follow suit] in adopting remote work.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 许多公司纷纷效仿，采用远程工作。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To engage in playful or foolish behavior.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 进行玩耍或愚蠢的行为

examples.sentence: They often [fool around] during class instead of paying attention.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他们在课堂上经常打闹，而不专心听课。

examples.sentence: He likes to [fool around] with his friends on the weekends.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他喜欢在周末和朋友一起玩乐。

examples.sentence: Instead of studying, they decided to [fool around] at the park.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他们决定不学习，而是在公园里玩耍。

meanings.meaning_en_US: A deceptive substance that resembles gold but is not valuable.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 一种类似黄金但不值钱的欺骗性物质

examples.sentence: Many miners were tricked by [fool’s gold] during the gold rush.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在淘金潮期间，许多矿工被假黄金欺骗。

examples.sentence: It’s important to recognize [fool’s gold] in business investments.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在商业投资中，识别假黄金是很重要的。

examples.sentence: He learned the hard way that some deals are just [fool’s gold].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他痛苦地意识到，有些交易只是空头支票。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To make progress or advance in a particular area.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在特定领域取得进展

examples.sentence: The company is [gaining ground] in the tech industry.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 这家公司在科技行业取得了进展。

examples.sentence: We need to [gain ground] on our competitors to succeed.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我们需要在竞争中取得优势才能成功。

examples.sentence: The team is [gaining ground] in their efforts to raise awareness.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 团队在提高意识的努力中正取得进展。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To retaliate against someone.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 对某人进行报复

examples.sentence: He plans to [get back at] his rival for the unfair treatment.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他计划对不公正的对待进行报复他的对手。

examples.sentence: She felt the need to [get back at] those who wronged her.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她感到有必要去报复那些伤害她的人。

examples.sentence: It's not right to [get back at] someone just because they upset you.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 仅仅因为他们让你不快而报复他们是不对的。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To successfully make contact or finish something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 成功联系或完成某事

examples.sentence: I finally managed to [get through] to customer service.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我终于成功联系到客户服务。

examples.sentence: We need to [get through] this project before the deadline.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我们需要在截止日期之前完成这个项目。

examples.sentence: She was relieved to [get through] the exam.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她很高兴通过了考试。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To fail or go bankrupt.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 失败或破产

examples.sentence: After years of struggles, the company finally went [belly up].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 经过多年的挣扎，这家公司终于破产了。

examples.sentence: His financial investments went [belly up] last year.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他的财务投资去年失败了。

examples.sentence: They were forced to close down when their plan went [belly up].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 当他们的计划失败时，他们被迫关闭。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To spend time doing nothing or being silly.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 无所事事或傻乎乎的行为消磨时间

examples.sentence: Instead of studying, they decided to [goof around] at the mall.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他们决定不学习，而是在商场晃荡。

examples.sentence: We used to [goof around] after school every day.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我们放学后每天都在玩耍。

examples.sentence: There's no time to [goof around] if we want to finish the project.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果想要完成项目，就没有时间可浪费。

meanings.meaning_en_US: A natural talent for gardening or growing plants.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 对园艺或种植植物的天赋

examples.sentence: She has a [green thumb] and can grow anything in her garden.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她有种植的天赋，能在花园里种植任何东西。

examples.sentence: People with a [green thumb] usually have beautiful homes.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 有园艺天赋的人通常拥有美丽的家。

examples.sentence: His [green thumb] has made his garden the envy of the neighborhood.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他的园艺天赋让他的花园成为邻里的羡慕。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To become too large for something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 长大到无法适应某物

examples.sentence: He's already starting to [grow out of] his shoes.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他已经开始穿不下他的鞋子了。

examples.sentence: She will soon [grow out of] her old clothes.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她很快就会穿不下她的旧衣服。

examples.sentence: Children eventually [grow out of] certain toys as they age.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 随着年龄的增长，孩子们最终会不再喜欢某些玩具。

meanings.meaning_en_US: An instinctive or intuitive feeling about something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 对某事的本能或直觉感觉

examples.sentence: I went with my [gut feeling] and took the job.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我根据本能的感觉接受了这个工作。

examples.sentence: Her [gut feeling] told her to leave the party early.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她的直觉告诉她要早点离开聚会。

examples.sentence: Sometimes, trusting your [gut feeling] is the right choice.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 有时候，相信你的直觉是正确的选择。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To spend time casually or idly.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 随意或闲散地度过时间

examples.sentence: We [hung around] at the park after school.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 放学后我们在公园闲逛。

examples.sentence: He likes to [hang around] with friends on weekends.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他喜欢在周末和朋友一起闲混。

examples.sentence: They often [hang around] the coffee shop after class.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他们下课后经常在咖啡店闲逛。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To go to bed.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 上床睡觉

examples.sentence: I'm really tired; I think I'll [hit the hay] early tonight.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我真累；我想今晚早点上床睡觉。

examples.sentence: After a long day, he decided to [hit the hay] after dinner.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 经过漫长的一天后，他决定吃完晚餐后上床睡觉。

examples.sentence: She usually [hits the hay] at 10 PM.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她通常在晚上10点上床睡觉。
